- 50% of the world is women.

The other 50% have been
given birth to by women.

In India, the goddess of
wealth is a woman, but still,

women in India don't
manage their own finances.

We did one of India's largest
surveys about women and money

and 98% women said they
have no retirement plan.
Those are worrying numbers.
LXME is India's first

and actually leading
financial platform for women.

How we started was with a
community, with the Ask platform,
which is your women-only community,
a safe space for them to come

and ask whatever the question
is and not be judged.

So we launched it with
ask, learn and invest,

and invest is a key part
of our platform, right?
That's where we also differentiate
from other platforms where we don't say
just learn or talk about it.
Actually take action.

LXME is actually completely
run on the AWS platform.

They have the latest
cutting-edge features.
They have a lot of support.
They're highly scalable.
They're highly secure, right?
And I think these things are necessary
for any financial institution.
Equality and freedom is incomplete
without financial freedom.
We had one person who said,
"I'm the first person in my family,

the first woman in my family
who manages her own money."

Someone just in the last one
year said, "I'm earning enough
but I was never able to save for my goals.
I bought my first house."

Now the next step and the
resounding request we've got

from our community is we also
want to launch neobanking.
So AWS actually has been really helpful.

We really use their expertise
to help us grow, scale
or build new products.

So there are 650 million
women in India, right?
That's massive scale.
That's like a few countries put together,

and for us to really achieve
what we want to at LXME,

helping women at scale, you
can't have on-prem servers.

You need someone like AWS
who can support that scale.

And I think that's been
our relationship with them
